faculty.research_interests:
To develop advanced theory, algorithms and numerically efficient codes to explain various properties, structure and behavior of materials. Recent interests involve:
- Magnetism and Spintronics
- Understanding exotic phases of Superconductors and Topological Insulators
- Effect of variable relaxation time on thermoelectric properties of materials
- Electronic and Optical properties of solar harvesting materials
- Electro and Photocatalysis
- Electronic Structure and Thermodynamics of Alloys: Transition metals, Binary and Ternary Alloys
- Long-range, Partial and Short-Range Ordering in Alloys
- Vibrational properties of intermetallic and disordered materials: Phonon dispersion, vibrational entropy, short-range ordering
- Response functions in materials with defects: Electrical conductivity, Electronic and Lattice thermal conductivity

documents.text: Varun Bhalerao is an Associate Professor in the Physics Department at IIT Bombay. His contact information includes phone number +91 22 2576 9379, extension 9379, and email varunb@iitb.ac.in.  His office is located in room 229-I (Opposite the mini seminar room).  His research interests encompass Astrophysics, specifically electromagnetic counterparts of gravitational wave sources, astrophysical instrumentation (X-ray telescopes), X-ray and optical studies of transient sources, and neutron stars and neutron star binaries.  For a complete list of publications, refer to ADS, arXiv, ORCID, or Google Scholar. He is associated with the Astronomy, Cosmology and Gravity (ACG) research group.
